Literatura en Espanol (SPAN3460)

Course level

Undergraduate

Faculty

Humanities and Social Sciences

School

Languages & Cultures School

Units

2

Duration

One Semester

Class contact

3 Contact hours

Incompatible

SPAN2460

Prerequisite

SPAN3110

Companion

SPAN3120

Recommended prerequisite

SPAN3330

Assessment methods

Two essays, two reading diaries, attendance and participation and written test.

Course coordinator

Dr Roberto Esposto

Study Abroad

This course is pre-approved for Study Abroad and Exchange students.

This course is not currently offered, please contact the school.

Course description

This course will provide students with an overview of the development of Hispanic literatures (Spain and Spanish America) from its origins to 20th Century. It will expose students to in-depth reading of representative texts from different periods and give evidence of the correlation between literary discourse and history of ideas. This course may be cancelled if there are fewer than 20 enrolments.
